comments:
Build ID: I20070323-1616

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Go to install new features and select europa
2. choosed an mirror
3. pick Java Development-> Eclipse Java Development Tools 3.3.0.v2

install reports failed with no extra debug info from command  line


More information:
Using a MacBook

(In reply to comment #1)
Performed the following tests:
TEST1
- installed a base 3.3 M6 Eclipse
- went to Help --> Software Update --> Find and Install --> Search for new features
- Selected Europa discovery site --> Finish
- Selected a mirror site
- Expanded the Java Development in the installable features list

--> note: no Eclipse Java Development Tools in the list (to be attached screen shot), which sounds ok to me, as this feature is included in the base Eclipse I installed, hence can not be re-installed.

So, my guess is that this feature was disabled (this might be verified in the .log file), due to some to be determined problem.
To assert this, performed the following:
TEST2
- shutdown Eclipse,
- moved the jdt feature from eclipse\features\ to another directory
- moved the jdt.jar file from eclipse\plugins\ to another directory
- re-started with the -clean option
- when to Europa update site again, expanded the Java Development item

--> found that I now had a new installable feature (Java Development Tools 3.3.0.v2xxxx) - to be attached screen shot

- selected this feature and clicked next to accept the license agreement, then finish to proceed with feature download
- finished installation and re-started the workbench as requested

--> so, no problem here

BUT:
if you select the [Hungary] i-Logic mirror server on the Update Site Mirrors page, the download aborts with an error message "Update Operation has failed"
--> seems to be the bug at hand

If you open the error log view, you'll find the following details:
Unable to retrieve remote reference "http://eclipse.i-logic.hu//releases/europa/features/org.eclipse.jdt_3.3.0.v20070319-1800-7n7dEAWEgDfeRYHuyAaFTR.jar". [Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://eclipse.i-logic.hu//releases/europa/features/org.eclipse.jdt_3.3.0.v20070319-1800-7n7dEAWEgDfeRYHuyAaFTR.jar.]

org.eclipse.update.internal.core.FatalIOException: Server returned HTTP response code: "403 Forbidden" for URL: http://eclipse.i-logic.hu//releases/europa/features/org.eclipse.jdt_3.3.0.v20070319-1800-7n7dEAWEgDfeRYHuyAaFTR.jar.
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.UpdateManagerUtils.checkConnectionResult(UpdateManagerUtils.java:561)
at org.eclipse.update.core.ContentReference.getInputStream(ContentReference.java:147)
at org.eclipse.update.core.FeatureContentProvider.asLocalReference(FeatureContentProvider.java:268)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.FeaturePackagedContentProvider.getFeatureEntryArchiveReferences(FeaturePackagedContentProvider.java:157)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.FeaturePackagedContentProvider.getFeatureManifestReference(FeaturePackagedContentProvider.java:83)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.FeaturePackagedFactory.createFeature(FeaturePackagedFactory.java:39)
at org.eclipse.update.core.Site.createFeature(Site.java:527)
at org.eclipse.update.core.FeatureReference.createFeature(FeatureReference.java:122)
at org.eclipse.update.core.FeatureReference.getFeature(FeatureReference.java:110)
at org.eclipse.update.core.FeatureReference.getFeature(FeatureReference.java:97)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.InstallWizard2.download(InstallWizard2.java:419)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.InstallWizard2.access$3(InstallWizard2.java:397)
at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.InstallWizard2$3.run(InstallWizard2.java:350)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)


So, the error here is not on jdt, but rather on the mirror site which returns a  "403 Forbidden".

To confirm this, I restarted with a base 3.3 M6 Eclipse, with the jdt tool correctly installed and choose to install the C/C++ feature from the Hungarian site
--> same problem "403 Forbidden".

To conclude:
- the fact that the Java Dev Tools appears in the installable Europa features list make me believe that Eclipse standard config was altered in some way, which inhibits the jdt feature.
--> this can be verified by editing the .log file

- Workaround: 
1 - proceed with the steps described in TEST1, selecting the UK or Switzerland mirror site, in order ton re-install the jdt feature,
2 - re-install a 3.3 M6 build

Opened bug 185041 to address the 403 error encountered when Hungarian site selected.
Until this bug is fixed, please select another mirror site if you intend to install other Europa features.

Created an attachment (id=65573)
screen shot

Standard Update wizard

Created an attachment (id=65574)
screen shot

Update wizard with the JDT
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 185041 ***

(In reply to comment #5)
Roy,
when I opened bug 185041, I wanted to track 2 separate issues:
- bug 185041: 403 forbidden access
- this bug: Java Dev Tooling appearing in the europa installable features
--> this is not expected / standard situation, and I wanted this one to remain opened until we discovered the reason why the base eclipse JDT feature was disabled

(In reply to comment #6)
> (In reply to comment #5)
> Roy,
> when I opened bug 185041, I wanted to track 2 separate issues:

Sorry about that.  I thought this was a dupe.

(In reply to comment #7)
No pb.
Thanks

(In reply to comment #8)
May the reporter of this bug please help us determine the reason his original Eclipse was altered (see my comments #1 and #6).
- start his current Eclipse config against a brand new workspace, and attach resulting .log file to this bug, 
and / or
- download and install a more recent build and try to reproduce the issue.
Thanks.

(In reply to comment #9)
Closing as invalid as the only way to reproduce the bug context is to corrupt
base Eclipse install.
Feel free to re-open the bug in case you still are able to reproduce it after a new Eclipse installation.
